department.dept_long_name: Committee on Concentration in Physical Sciences

course.title: Electromagnetism, Circuits, Waves, Optics, and Imaging
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 9:30-11, and a weekly section and lab to be arranged.
course.description: This course is an introduction to electromagnetism, digital information, waves, optics and sound. Topics covered include: electric and magnetic fields, electrical potential, circuits, simple digital circuits, wave propagation in various media, microscopy, sound and hearing. The course will draw upon a variety of applications to the biological sciences and will use real-world examples to illustrate many of the physical principles described. There are six laboratories.
course.prerequisites: Physical Sciences 2 (or Physics 1a or 11a), Mathematics 1b, or equivalent.
course.notes: This course is part of an integrated introduction to the physical sciences intended for students who plan to pursue a concentration in the life sciences and/or satisfy pre-medical requirements in Physics. May not ordinarily be taken for credit in addition to Physics 1b, 11b, or 15b. This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Science of the Physical Universe or Empirical and Mathematical Reasoning, but not both.
